name: NPR
text:
2020 has been a lot â€” and Iceland is ready to help.

The tourist board has developed an app that lets you record a scream, pent up by the pandemic, then broadcasts it from speakers in the Icelandic wilderness.
https://t.co/W29K9fnYHX

name: NPR
text: The Toronto Blue Jays baseball team won't be playing in Toronto this regular season after the Canadian government rejected a plan for the team to host home games there, citing coronavirus concerns. https://t.co/XXyxNzVntv

name: NPR
text: Over a 24-hour period, the world saw nearly 260,000 new coronavirus cases â€” a new record. https://t.co/tJJOU1PJaV

name: NPR
text: Even before the age of social distancing, composer and conductor Eric Whitacre had been leading an online chorus for a decade. Choir members say the connection they foster is more important than ever. https://t.co/cFuxuOA3It

name: NPR
text:
Facebook agreed to settle a class-action suit claiming it violated users' privacy by scanning faces in its "tag suggestion" feature.

The deal was expected to let Illinois users collect $150.

But the judge is demanding that Facebook pay much more.
https://t.co/RJwSoPofWf

name: NPR
text:
Maria Konnikova is a professional poker player. So, @waitwait invited her to play a game called "You've got to know when to hold 'em, know when to fold 'em" â€” 3 questions about "The Gambler," Kenny Rogers.
https://t.co/YS606mwwBw

name: NPR
text:
The new HBO documentary "Showbiz Kids" gives current and former child actors â€” from Evan Rachel Wood to the late Cameron Boyce  â€” the chance to talk about abuse, money, work and finding your way as an adult.
https://t.co/PZZjiXC4z5

name: NPR
text:
A few months ago, @NPRLifeKit shared instructions on how to make a #quaranzine â€” a mini-zine documenting life during the pandemic.

Here's a look at a few that you shared with us ðŸ‘‡

name: NPR
text:
Photographers around the world introduce us to the newborns of 2020. 

The parents share their hopes, dreams and fears â€” offering a glimpse of what it's like to welcome a baby during a global pandemic.  
https://t.co/RfW3kVXPTO

name: NPR
text:
Romance novel characters often face outlandish obstacles â€” pirates, spies, paranormal forces, secret plots. But this month's round-up of novels focuses on down-to-earth stories about balancing love and career.
https://t.co/cKbidZPK2D

name: NPR
text:
As a college student, even if you want to social distance, how do you do it?

Tressie McMillan Cottom, PhD, assoc. professor at UNC-Chapel Hill,  and @npritsbeenamin's Sam Sanders talk about the state of higher education in the pandemic. https://t.co/qggCqeU0qX https://t.co/FutZ1FsIhG

name: NPR
text:
Critically ill COVID-19 patients in hospitals with less than 50 ICU beds "had a more than threefold higher risk of death than patients admitted to larger hospitals," says the author of a nationwide study.

He spoke to @commonhealth about those findings: https://t.co/1Vj8YpByCL

name: NPR
text: The Trump administration is rejecting new DACA applications from young immigrants who have never signed up before â€” despite the Supreme Court ruling that allowed the program to continue. https://t.co/Zalm9Dp8DR
